body.p: Nemerle is a new programming language with the following planned features:

ul.li: Language with strong polymorphic typing compiled to CIL (.NET), similar to OCaml
Type inheritance and dynamic types introduced on demand which makes programming less error prone but still as easy as in scripting languages
Efficient integration of functional constructs with imperative and object oriented code together with high level optimizations that makes it possible to create efficient code with high level language
Easy to write syntax extensions that make programming easier and facilitate the work on large projects
Translation to and from TRS that gives support for integration with automatic testing, program verification and profiling tools

Compatibility with CLI (Common Language Infrastructure, part of Microsoft's .NET framework) that gives access to a large set of libraries, code written in other languages and it works on different software platforms

body.p: At present the work on Nemerle is in early stages where we finish the first compiler of the core version of the language. The compiler is written in OCaml and will be used to bootstrap the full Nemerle compiler later. To compile it you need OCaml 3.06 and to generate the documentation you need xsltproc and xspp. All generated documentation is available from this site.

ul.li: Version of this page for offline browsing: download/nemerle-web.tar.gz. It does not include compiler and documentation sources.
Latest compiler and documentation source snapshot: download/nemerle-latest.tar.gz.
Compiler and documentation source snapshots in download/.

Project sources are kept in Subversion repository. You can access it with web browser at http://nemerle.org/cgi-bin/svn/, or with Subversion (or other WebDAV enabled client) at http://nemerle.org/svn/. You can also use http://nemerle.org:81/svn/ or https://nemerle.org/svn/ to bypass HTTP proxies. We also provide hourly incremental dumps of repository at svn-backup/.

body.p: To meet our goals we divided our work into three parts:

ul.li: Core Nemerle compiler written in OCaml that does not support some of the features and generates C# code. It will be used to bootstrap the full Nemerle compiler

Nemerle compiler written in core Nemerle that will generate CIL or generic CIL code and will have support for syntax extensions, extended type inference, full code commenting convention and documentation generation and well designed searchable and extensible standard library

Abstract Nemerle language generation for Nemerle compiler and back translation from Abstract Nemerle to Nemerle. Translation between Abstract Nemerle and Term Rewriting Systems and tools to facilitate logical analysis of Nemerle code

body.p: At present we are finishing the core Nemerle compiler in OCaml and we have a description of the work we want to do in the next stages.

Core Nemerle:

body.p: We also have section about our aims to create formal semantics for Nemerle language, but it isn't any far.
The language implementation will be licensed under one of open source licenses, probably BSD-like one.
The language is being worked on at the Computer Science Institute of University of Wroclaw by Lukasz Kaiser, Michal Moskal and Andrzej Wasylkowski.
